item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T00:40:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-26
  • City: BRADFORD

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: After loading the tanker, the associate drove over to the customer's scale. It is approximately 1/4 of a mile on a public roadway. It was noticed that the top rear dome had started to leak while on the scale. Internally, the material was cleaned up. The driver proceeded to reseat and resealed the rear lid. The total amount release is estimated at 1 gallon.

item.title: Report E-2024100241
item.description:
Report E-2024100241

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: MCKEES ROCKS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight Lines observed a spill of about one (1) cup of an unidentified material from one (1) ten (10) gallon metal drum. The release impacted the trailer floor. Personnel advised the drum was discovered damaged, as the strap did not hold, and the freight fell in transit. Due to a trade name for the material not being identified, the spill was cleaned at the terminal using PPE and absorbent they had available. Dayton Freight Lines advised they generated one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâs contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100739
item.description:
Report E-2024100739

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-24
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During a routine inspection at Veolia's ten day in-transit facility in Philadelphia, PA, Veolia staff discovered a compromised container. Upon investigation, they found that inner packages had leaked through three outer containers and were generating heat through a chemical reaction with the absorbent material present. It was determined that 5 x 1 gallon inner packages in each of the three containers were not upright and had leaked through vented caps onto an absorbent. It was further determined the absorbent utilized by the shipper contained organic material which resulted in the reaction and heat generation. The material was repackaged with all inner packages up right and placed in individual plastic bags with inorganic cushioning and absorbent to prevent any reaction resulting in three 55 gallon drums and one 30 gallon drum. The original absorbent material was wetted, placed into containers and transported for disposal along with the repackaged packages.

item.title: Report I-2024090044
item.description:
Report I-2024090044

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: JEANNETTE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver noticed product leaking as he was taking a break and notified supervision. The leak was coming from the crash/spill box area. The driver began to drive the equipment and was instructed by supervision to stop driving the equipment and pull into a safe area. The driver stopped and the local municipality's fire department and EHS arrived at the scene, as well as, a third party environmental clean-up company, McCutcheon's. The HCL was off-loaded into 10 totes, which were loaded into straight truck with a lift gate, approximately 1,600gallons were off-loaded into another Univar tanker and taken to the Univar Altoona plant, and the remaining product remained in the original tanker. The 10 totes and original tanker were taken to the Univar Solutions Bunola plant. Approximately 20 gallons of HCL was released. Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Protection conducted a site visit and provided a satisfactory rating for the response and clean up. PADEP #1410124

item.title: Report E-2024100720
item.description:
Report E-2024100720

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: BENSALEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNA experienced a UN1830 Semi-Grade Sulfuric Acid release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of UN1830 Semi-Grade Sulfuric Acid released to a 53â x 8â area of the trailer floor and 800â x 55â area of the asphalt lot due to forklift puncture. The contractors used water and sodium bicarb mixture to clean the impacted areas. The damaged drum and impacted pallets were cut up and containerized. The impacted absorbents were collected and containerized. All waste was placed into (16) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
